Yanagida: 4.131,06; WU/GU: 363; FO: 817; JDCDL: 266ǎ

sense.def: song; popular song (also that of primitive peoples etc) 人聲曰歌. 歌柯也. 所歌之言是其質也. 以聲吟詠有上下如草木之有柯葉也. 故兗冀言 歌聲如柯也 Songs of humans are called gē. gē “song” is kē “branch.” The words sung, these are the substance. sense.def: what (this question word appeared during the Tang and can be found on some Dunhuang manuscripts and texts from the Tang period; it is identical in function with the earlier 是 'what' as well as with 什 'what' which appeared somewhat later, 是, 甚,什 seem to be different transliteration of the same colloquial phonem; 是, 甚,什 gradually replaced 何 from the Six Dyn. period onwards; 甚 is rarely used in compound words: 甚沒 (BLZ), 甚物, 甚謨 (Stein 2669), 甚生 (Tang, Bianwen), 甚摩 (Five Dyn.), 甚麼 (early Song))

tls:srcline.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄

tls:line.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄(en)

tls:text.tls:line: "Just get so you can follow along with circumstances and use up your old karma.

sense.def: BUDDH: skr. karma; pali kamma (lit. action, deed of karmic significance)This is agency which brings forth 'existence' (yǒu 有 ) and is in turn caused by mental defilements (usually 'craving' (tṛṣṇā) and 'ignorance' (avidyā)); the concept of karma in India predates the emergence of Buddhism, but was somewhat redefined in Buddhism and Śākyamuni was said to have put much emphasis on the law of moral causality which is determined by one's actions; karma is often subdivided in three kind of actions: physical, shēnyè 身業, skr. kāya-karman, PALI kāya-kamma; verbal, kǒuyè 口業, SANSKRIT vāk-karman, PALI vacī-kamma; mental, yìyè 意業, skr. manas-karma, PALI mano-kamma, mental karma is sometims also referred to as 'non-manifest' or 'latent' action (skr. avijñapti, PALI aviññatti, wúbiǎoyè 無表業; another method of classifying karma is according to the nature of the actions, i.e. 'wholesome deeds', shànyè 善業, SANSKRIT kuśala-karman, PALI kusala-kamma; and 'evil deeds', èyè 惡業, skr. pāpa-karman, pali pāpa-kammaFocusing on the destiny after death which are caused by one's actions, karma is divided into fúyè 福業, 'meritorious actions' (skr. puṇya, pali puñña), and demeritorious actions, fēifúyè 非福業, skr. apuṇya, pali apuñña)(Actions which lead to rebirth in the three realms, sānjiè 三界 (including good and bad actions) are referred to as 'defiled actions' yǒulòuyè 有漏業, skr. sāsrava-karman; by contrast there are 'undefiled actions', wúlòuyè 無漏業, skr. anāsrava-karman (often referring to the actions of a Bodhisattva; in the case of Buddha one speaks of fóshì 佛事, 'Buddha-deeds', skr. buddha-kāryaThe concept of karma is further complicated by the question who and what transmigrates, since in Buddhism the existence of an entity surviving death is denied (one of the later approaches to solve thia aporia was the assumption of a 'storehouse-consciousness', ālaya-vijñāna by the Yogācāra School)

tls:text.tls:line: 'If you try to create good karma and seek to be a buddha,

sense.def: BUDDH: skr. karma; pali kamma (lit. action, deed of karmic significance)This is agency which brings forth 'existence' (yǒu 有 ) and is in turn caused by mental defilements (usually 'craving' (tṛṣṇā) and 'ignorance' (avidyā)); the concept of karma in India predates the emergence of Buddhism, but was somewhat redefined in Buddhism and Śākyamuni was said to have put much emphasis on the law of moral causality which is determined by one's actions; karma is often subdivided in three kind of actions: physical, shēnyè 身業, skr. kāya-karman, PALI kāya-kamma; verbal, kǒuyè 口業, SANSKRIT vāk-karman, PALI vacī-kamma; mental, yìyè 意業, skr. manas-karma, PALI mano-kamma, mental karma is sometims also referred to as 'non-manifest' or 'latent' action (skr. avijñapti, PALI aviññatti, wúbiǎoyè 無表業; another method of classifying karma is according to the nature of the actions, i.e. 'wholesome deeds', shànyè 善業, SANSKRIT kuśala-karman, PALI kusala-kamma; and 'evil deeds', èyè 惡業, skr. pāpa-karman, pali pāpa-kammaFocusing on the destiny after death which are caused by one's actions, karma is divided into fúyè 福業, 'meritorious actions' (skr. puṇya, pali puñña), and demeritorious actions, fēifúyè 非福業, skr. apuṇya, pali apuñña)(Actions which lead to rebirth in the three realms, sānjiè 三界 (including good and bad actions) are referred to as 'defiled actions' yǒulòuyè 有漏業, skr. sāsrava-karman; by contrast there are 'undefiled actions', wúlòuyè 無漏業, skr. anāsrava-karman (often referring to the actions of a Bodhisattva; in the case of Buddha one speaks of fóshì 佛事, 'Buddha-deeds', skr. buddha-kāryaThe concept of karma is further complicated by the question who and what transmigrates, since in Buddhism the existence of an entity surviving death is denied (one of the later approaches to solve thia aporia was the assumption of a 'storehouse-consciousness', ālaya-vijñāna by the Yogācāra School)

tls:srcline.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄

tls:line.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄(en)

tls:text.tls:line: then Buddha will become a sure sign you will remain in the realm of birth and death.'

sense.def: BUDDH: the cycle of life of death, transmigration (other translations include lúnhuí 輪迴; the destinations of these transmigrations do not only include human life but also other forms of existence in the liùdào 六道 Six Destinations, such as God (deva), human being (manuṣya). demon or demigod (asura 阿修羅), animal (tiryagyoni 畜生), hungry ghost (preta, 餓鬼), or hell-dweller (naraka, 地獄; the destiny of a person is dependent on his deeds (karma, yè 業) in his previous lives) (ant. to 涅槃 nirvāṇa); skr. saṃsāra)

sense.def: BUDDH: all constituents of existence; all dharmas (referring to physical as well as non-physical objects, also including mental objects, etc.)

tls:srcline.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄

tls:line.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄(en)

tls:text.tls:line: are in all cases devoid of intrinsic nature.

sense.def: everyone; anyone; all of them (quantifies then) (The manifest verbal derivation is from "be together", hence this is not construed as an nadV.)

tls:srcline.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄

tls:line.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄(en)

tls:text.tls:line: are in all cases devoid of intrinsic nature.

sense.def: BUDDH: self-nature; intrinsic nature; essential nature (i.e. something which exits independently from other constituents of existense, therefore "self-nature" is denied in Buddhist philosophy) SANSKRIT: tathatā; dharmatā; svabhāva; prakṛti See DDB: http://www.buddhism-dict.net/cgi-bin/xpr-ddb.pl?81.xml+id('b81ea-6027')

tls:srcline.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄

tls:line.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄(en)

tls:text.tls:line: They are also devoid of any nature that manifests itself.

sense.def: arisen nature SANSKRIT: prabhavatā

tls:srcline.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄

tls:line.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄(en)

tls:text.tls:line: They are empty names,

sense.def: insubstantial (without reality)

tls:srcline.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄

tls:line.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄(en)

tls:text.tls:line: and the words used to describe them are likewise empty.

sense.def: name

tls:srcline.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄

tls:line.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄(en)

tls:text.tls:line: and the words used to describe them are likewise empty.

sense.def: likewise; also; as well (referring to predicate, often with repetition of the verb)

tls:srcline.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄

tls:line.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄(en)

tls:text.tls:line: and the words used to describe them are likewise empty.

sense.def: BUDDH: empty, void, insubstantial (without self-nature, interdependent, and subject to constant change); skr. śūnya

tls:srcline.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄

tls:text.tls:srcline:
爾秖麼
認他閑名為實，

tls:line.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄(en)

tls:text.tls:line: But you insist on mistaking these idle names for reality.

sense.def: but; but instead; whereas; nevertheless (Song colloquial)

tls:srcline.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄

tls:text.tls:srcline:
爾秖麼
認他閑名為實，

tls:line.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄(en)

tls:text.tls:line: But you insist on mistaking these idle names for reality.

sense.def: to recognize N1 as N2; to reckon that N1 is N2

tls:srcline.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄

tls:text.tls:srcline:
爾秖麼
認他閑名為實，

tls:line.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄(en)

tls:text.tls:line: But you insist on mistaking these idle names for reality.

sense.def: 'other': this is an idiomatic usage of tā in medieval texts, marking the object as something not desired by the speaker, something which is contrary to his intention; this usage is very particular and seems to mark something the speaker wants to distance himself/herself from; often put in contrast to the "desired" object; this usage of tā deserves a more detailed analysis

tls:srcline.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄

tls:text.tls:srcline:
爾秖麼
認他閑名為實，

tls:line.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄(en)

tls:text.tls:line: But you insist on mistaking these idle names for reality.

sense.def: idle; irrelevant; (not pertaining to a substance)

tls:srcline.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄

tls:text.tls:srcline:
爾秖麼
認他閑名為實，

tls:line.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄(en)

tls:text.tls:line: But you insist on mistaking these idle names for reality.

sense.def: really existing thing > real object

tls:srcline.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄

tls:line.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄(en)

tls:text.tls:line: This is a great error.

sense.def: make mistakes

tls:srcline.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄

tls:line.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄(en)

tls:text.tls:line: This is a great error.

sense.def: vernacular sentence final construction indicating the perfective: (already) have Ved

tls:srcline.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄

tls:line.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄(en)

tls:text.tls:line: Even if something did exist,

sense.def: to suppose hypothetically, let us suppose hypothetically(sometimes correlating with 亦 in S2)

tls:srcline.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄

tls:line.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄(en)

tls:text.tls:line: it would in all cases be no more than an environment that changes with what it depends on.

sense.def: what one relies on > dependency

tls:srcline.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄

tls:line.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄(en)

tls:text.tls:line: it would in all cases be no more than an environment that changes with what it depends on.

sense.def: changing accordingly > dependent [CA}

tls:srcline.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄

tls:line.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄(en)

tls:text.tls:line: it would in all cases be no more than an environment that changes with what it depends on.

sense.def: BUDDH: abstract region, sphere; context; circumstances (> external mental stimulus > external stimulus); also: realm of the mind > objects of perception; skr. viṣaya (see 六境 ) (the term has a very wide range of meanings; see DDBhttp://www.buddhism-dict.net/cgi-bin/xpr-ddb.pl?58.xml+id('b5883')It became a central term in the 臨濟錄, see Anderl 2007: Informal Notes on the Term "jing" 境 in the Linji lu 臨濟錄. In: Wenxue yu zongjiao - Sun Changwu jiaoshou qishi huadan jinian wenji 文學與宗教 - 孫昌武教授七十華誕紀念文集 [Literature and Religion - Festschrift on the Occasion of Prof. Sun Changwu's 70th Birthday]. Beijing: Zongjiao wenhua chubanshe 宗教文化出板社 2007. ISBN 9787801239020. pp. 391-423)

tls:srcline.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄

依、菩薩依、佛依。

tls:line.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄(en)

tls:text.tls:line: There is this dependent condition called bodhi, the dependent condition called nirvana, the dependent condition of emancipation, the dependent condition of the threefold body, the dependent condition of environment and wisdom, the dependent condition of bodhisattva, the dependent condition of Buddha.

sense.def: general classifier (with deleted numeral and with inanimate N); seems occasionally to have a function similar to a indefinite article

tls:srcline.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄

tls:text.tls:srcline:
有箇菩提依、涅繫依、解脫依、三身依、境智
依、菩薩依、佛依。

tls:line.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄(en)

tls:text.tls:line: There is this dependent condition called bodhi, the dependent condition called nirvana, the dependent condition of emancipation, the dependent condition of the threefold body, the dependent condition of environment and wisdom, the dependent condition of bodhisattva, the dependent condition of Buddha.

sense.def: BUDDH: wisdom; enlightenment skr. bodhi

tls:srcline.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄

tls:text.tls:srcline:
有箇菩提依、涅繫依、解脫依、三身依、境智
依、菩薩依、佛依。

tls:line.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄(en)

tls:text.tls:line: There is this dependent condition called bodhi, the dependent condition called nirvana, the dependent condition of emancipation, the dependent condition of the threefold body, the dependent condition of environment and wisdom, the dependent condition of bodhisattva, the dependent condition of Buddha.

sense.def: BUDDH: deliverance; liberation (from defilements and suffering), emancipation; skr. mokṣa, mukti, vimokṣa, vimukti; pali mokkha, mutti, vimokkha, vimutti

tls:srcline.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄

tls:text.tls:srcline:
有箇菩提依、涅繫依、解脫依、三身依、境智
依、菩薩依、佛依。

tls:line.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄(en)

tls:text.tls:line: There is this dependent condition called bodhi, the dependent condition called nirvana, the dependent condition of emancipation, the dependent condition of the threefold body, the dependent condition of environment and wisdom, the dependent condition of bodhisattva, the dependent condition of Buddha.

sense.def: BUDDH: the three 'bodies' of the Buddha, skr. trayaḥ kāyāḥ (consisting of the 法身 (dharma-kāya), the 報身 (saṃbhoga-kāya; sometimes referred to as 'enjoyment-body', 'wisdom-body' or 'retribution-body'), and the 應身 (nirmāṇa-kāya; sometimes translated with 'merit-body' or 'transformation-body'); there are countless terms, theories, and interpretations related to 三身)

tls:srcline.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄

tls:text.tls:srcline:
有箇菩提依、涅繫依、解脫依、三身依、境智
依、菩薩依、佛依。

tls:line.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄(en)

tls:text.tls:line: There is this dependent condition called bodhi, the dependent condition called nirvana, the dependent condition of emancipation, the dependent condition of the threefold body, the dependent condition of environment and wisdom, the dependent condition of bodhisattva, the dependent condition of Buddha.

sense.def: BUDDH: the cognitive function of perceiving objects; knowledge of the objective sphere; SANSKRIT: jñena-jñāna See DDB: http://www.buddhism-dict.net/cgi-bin/xpr-ddb.pl?58.xml+id('b5883-667a')

tls:srcline.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄

tls:text.tls:srcline:
有箇菩提依、涅繫依、解脫依、三身依、境智
依、菩薩依、佛依。

tls:line.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄(en)

tls:text.tls:line: There is this dependent condition called bodhi, the dependent condition called nirvana, the dependent condition of emancipation, the dependent condition of the threefold body, the dependent condition of environment and wisdom, the dependent condition of bodhisattva, the dependent condition of Buddha.

sense.def: BUDDH: bodhisattva (religious ideal in Mahāyāna Buddhism: sentient being who has set out on the path of enlightenment or has reached enlightenment; he remains in the cycle of life and death in order assist other beings on their way to salvation.)

tls:srcline.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄

tls:text.tls:srcline:
有箇菩提依、涅繫依、解脫依、三身依、境智
依、菩薩依、佛依。

tls:line.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄(en)

tls:text.tls:line: There is this dependent condition called bodhi, the dependent condition called nirvana, the dependent condition of emancipation, the dependent condition of the threefold body, the dependent condition of environment and wisdom, the dependent condition of bodhisattva, the dependent condition of Buddha.

sense.def: BUDDH: skr. nirvāṇa (tranquility; the cessation of suffering)

tls:text.tls:line: "And things like the three vehicles and the twelve divisions of the scriptural teachings -

sense.def: when it comes to N it V-s (then one arrives at > often used when shifting the attention to a new topic in a sequence of topics)

tls:srcline.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄

tls:text.tls:line: "And things like the three vehicles and the twelve divisions of the scriptural teachings -

sense.def: BUDDH: the Three Vehicles (from the Mahayāna standpoint this refers to the vehicles of the śrāvaka 聲聞, pratyekabuddha 緣覺, and bodhisattva 菩薩; the first two are often (derogatorily) referred to as 二乘 'the Two (minor) Vehicles'); SANSKRIT yānatraya, tri-yānika

tls:srcline.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄

tls:line.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄(en)

tls:text.tls:line: "And things like the three vehicles and the twelve divisions of the scriptural teachings -

sense.def: BUDDH: the teachings as described in the Buddhist canon divided into twelve divisions (in the Chán context often derogatory for all teachings based on written texts, as opposed to teachings based on experience)

tls:srcline.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄

tls:line.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄(en)

tls:text.tls:line: So we know clearly that the Buddha is a phantom.

sense.def: BUDDH: transformation through magic, illusionary transformation (this word often appears as a metaphor in Buddhist texts. The world as we perceive it is nothing but an illusion and the constituents of existence appear in it conditioned by many factors interdependent of each other. However, since all constituents of existence are in reality empty, their appearance is false, comparable to the show of a magician)

tls:srcline.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄

tls:text.tls:srcline: 所以達六種色、聲、香、味、觸、法

tls:line.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄(en)

tls:text.tls:line: Therefore we can tell that these six things, form, sound, odor, taste, touch, and Dharma,

sense.def: understand that S

tls:srcline.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄

tls:text.tls:srcline: 所以達六種色、聲、香、味、觸、法

tls:line.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄(en)

tls:text.tls:line: Therefore we can tell that these six things, form, sound, odor, taste, touch, and Dharma,

sense.def: BUDDH: constituent of existence (GERMAN Gegebenheit); skr. dharma zhūfǎ 諸法 all dharmas, all constituents of existence (referring to physical as well as non-physical objects, also including mental objects, etc.)

tls:srcline.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄

tls:line.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄(en)

sense.def: BUDDH: characteristic; mark; distinguishing feature; sometimes trans. skr. lakṣana

tls:srcline.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄

tls:line.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄(en)

tls:text.tls:line: They can never bind or fetter this man of the Way who depends on nothing.

sense.def: bind; tie up; put in fetters

tls:srcline.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄

tls:line.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄(en)

tls:text.tls:line: They can never bind or fetter this man of the Way who depends on nothing.

sense.def: Buddhist of the true faith

tls:srcline.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄

tls:line.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄(en)

tls:text.tls:line: Though his substance is defiled, made up of the five aggregates,

sense.def: BUDDH: made up of the Five Aggregates

tls:srcline.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄

tls:line.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄(en)

tls:text.tls:line: Though his substance is defiled, made up of the five aggregates,

sense.def: defiled

tls:srcline.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄

tls:line.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄(en)

tls:text.tls:line: Though his substance is defiled, made up of the five aggregates,

sense.def: substance; basis; material base

tls:srcline.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄

tls:line.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄(en)

tls:text.tls:line: he has the transcendental power of walking on the earth.

sense.def: BUDDH: this originally refers to the supernatural powers of a Buddha; spritual powers; sometimes referring to the five sagely powers (五神通) or the six supernatural powers of a holy man (六神通 skr. abijñā)

tls:srcline.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄

tls:line.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄(en)

tls:text.tls:line: "Followers of the Way,

sense.def: you, followers of the Way

tls:srcline.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄

tls:line.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄(en)

tls:text.tls:line: the true Buddha is without form, the true Dharma is without characterstics.

sense.def: BUDDH: be without distinguishing feature, be formless, be No-mark (see also shíxiàng 實相)

tls:srcline.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄

tls:text.tls:srcline:
爾秖麼
幻化上頭作模作樣，

tls:line.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄(en)

tls:text.tls:line: You are striking poses and donning attitudes all because of a mere phantom.

sense.def: but; but instead; whereas; nevertheless (Song colloquial)

tls:srcline.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄

tls:text.tls:srcline:
爾秖麼
幻化上頭作模作樣，

tls:line.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄(en)

tls:text.tls:line: You are striking poses and donning attitudes all because of a mere phantom.

sense.def: BUDDH: transformation through magic, illusionary transformation (this word often appears as a metaphor in Buddhist texts. The world as we perceive it is nothing but an illusion and the constituents of existence appear in it conditioned by many factors interdependent of each other. However, since all constituents of existence are in reality empty, their appearance is false, comparable to the show of a magician)

tls:srcline.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄

tls:line.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄(en)

tls:text.tls:line: Even if in your seeking you got something,

sense.def: to suppose hypothetically, let us suppose hypothetically(sometimes correlating with 亦 in S2)

tls:srcline.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄

tls:line.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄(en)

tls:text.tls:line: it would all be thbe work of wild fox spirits,

sense.def: BUDDH: wild fox spirit (derogatory and colloquial expression for somebody who has gone astray and ignorant)

tls:srcline.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄

tls:line.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄(en)

tls:text.tls:line: It would be the understanding of the non-Buddhists.

sense.def: BUDDH: those of an extraneous doctrine > heretic, follower of a wrong or inferior teaching (can apply to scholars/masters/monks within or without the Buddhist tradition)

tls:srcline.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄

tls:line.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄(en)

tls:text.tls:line: It would be the understanding of the non-Buddhists.

sense.def: understanding, insight

tls:srcline.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄

tls:line.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄(en)

tls:text.tls:line: never concerns himself with the Buddha,

sense.def: grasp (with abstract objects); hold on to (an opinion, concept, idea, etc.)

tls:srcline.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄

tls:line.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄(en)

tls:text.tls:line: never concerns himself with bodhisattvas or arhats,

sense.def: grasp (with abstract objects); hold on to (an opinion, concept, idea, etc.)

tls:srcline.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄

tls:line.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄(en)

tls:text.tls:line: never concerns himself with bodhisattvas or arhats,

sense.def: BUDDH: bodhisattva (religious ideal in Mahāyāna Buddhism: sentient being who has set out on the path of enlightenment or has reached enlightenment; he remains in the cycle of life and death in order assist other beings on their way to salvation.)

tls:srcline.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄

tls:line.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄(en)

tls:text.tls:line: never concerns himself with bodhisattvas or arhats,

sense.def: BUDDH: skr. arhat

tls:srcline.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄

tls:line.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄(en)

tls:text.tls:line: never concerns himself with the blessings of the threeford world.

sense.def: grasp (with abstract objects); hold on to (an opinion, concept, idea, etc.)

tls:srcline.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄

tls:line.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄(en)

tls:text.tls:line: never concerns himself with the blessings of the threeford world.

sense.def: BUDDH: the Triple-world > comprising the three worlds of existence (欲界 'world of desire'; 色界 'world of form'; 無色界 'world of formlessness'); skr. trayo dhātavaḥ, tri-dhātu; pali tisso dhātuyo

tls:srcline.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄

tls:text.tls:srcline:
逈
無獨脫不與物拘，

tls:line.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄(en)

tls:text.tls:line: Far removed, alone and free, he is never entangled in things.

sense.def: this is a rare usage of 與 marking the agent in passive construction

tls:srcline.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄

tls:text.tls:srcline:
逈
無獨脫不與物拘，

tls:line.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄(en)

tls:text.tls:line: Far removed, alone and free, he is never entangled in things.

sense.def: be limited by, be confined by

tls:srcline.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄

tls:line.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄(en)

tls:text.tls:line: Heaven and earth could turn upside down and he would not be perturbed.

sense.def: Heaven and Earth

tls:srcline.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄

tls:line.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄(en)

tls:text.tls:line: Heaven and earth could turn upside down and he would not be perturbed.

sense.def: collapse

tls:srcline.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄

tls:line.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄(en)

tls:text.tls:line: Heaven and earth could turn upside down and he would not be perturbed.

sense.def: be doubtful (of situations), be left in doubt (of people)

tls:srcline.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄

tls:line.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄(en)

tls:text.tls:line: All the buddhas of the ten directions could appear before him

sense.def: of the ten directions; everywhere

tls:srcline.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄

tls:line.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄(en)

tls:text.tls:line: and his mind would not feel an instant of joy,

sense.def: of (an instance of) thought (of (a single) a moment)

tls:srcline.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄

tls:line.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄(en)

tls:text.tls:line: and his mind would not feel an instant of joy,

sense.def: become glad; become happy

tls:srcline.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄

tls:line.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄(en)

tls:text.tls:line: the three realms of hell could suddenly confront him

sense.def: BUDDH: three ways of life: of hell, of beasts, of hungry ghosts (see also 六道)

tls:srcline.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄

tls:line.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄(en)

tls:text.tls:line: the three realms of hell could suddenly confront him

sense.def: BUDDH: hell (the lowest of the Six Destinations, liùdào 六道, thought to be located somewhere underground); skr. naraka

tls:srcline.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄

tls:line.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄(en)

tls:text.tls:line: the three realms of hell could suddenly confront him

sense.def: Lu Ji, Wenfu: instantly, at one go

tls:srcline.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄

tls:line.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄(en)

tls:text.tls:line: the three realms of hell could suddenly confront him

sense.def: become visible, appear, come to light; show one's face

tls:srcline.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄

tls:line.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄(en)

tls:text.tls:line: and his mind would not feel an instant of alarm.

sense.def: be intensely frightened, terrified

tls:srcline.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄

tls:line.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄(en)

tls:text.tls:line: Why is he like this?

sense.def: why, for what reason

tls:srcline.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄

tls:line.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄(en)

tls:text.tls:line: Because he knows that all things is the phenominal world are empty of characterstics.

sense.def: BUDDH: all constituents of existence; all dharmas (referring to physical as well as non-physical objects, also including mental objects, etc.)

tls:srcline.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄

tls:line.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄(en)

tls:text.tls:line: Because he knows that all things is the phenominal world are empty of characterstics.

sense.def: emptiness 養空 "cultivate emptiness"BUDDH: emptiness, voidness (the notion of emptiness developed into one of the key terms of Mahāyāna Buddhism; for explanations in secondary literature see 'sources'); SANSKRIT śūnyatā

tls:srcline.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄

tls:line.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄(en)

tls:text.tls:line: Because he knows that all things is the phenominal world are empty of characterstics.

sense.def: BUDDH: characteristic; mark; distinguishing feature; sometimes trans. skr. lakṣana

tls:srcline.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄

tls:line.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄(en)

tls:text.tls:line: When conditions change, they come into existence;

sense.def: change one's original ways; change from one's original state; change one's standard course (as the heavenly bodies)

tls:srcline.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄

tls:line.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄(en)

tls:text.tls:line: when there is no change, they do not exist.

sense.def: be absent; not exist; be lacking

tls:srcline.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄

tls:line.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄(en)

tls:text.tls:line: The threefold world is nothing but mind; the ten thousand phenomena are nothing but consciousness.

sense.def: BUDDH: the Triple-world > comprising the three worlds of existence (欲界 'world of desire'; 色界 'world of form'; 無色界 'world of formlessness'); skr. trayo dhātavaḥ, tri-dhātu; pali tisso dhātuyo

tls:srcline.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄

tls:line.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄(en)

tls:text.tls:line: The threefold world is nothing but mind; the ten thousand phenomena are nothing but consciousness.

sense.def: be N; be N (and none/nothing else)

tls:srcline.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄

tls:line.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄(en)

tls:line.title: 鎮州臨濟慧照禪師語錄(en)

tls:text.tls:line: such persons are all just creating karma.

sense.def: BUDDH: skr. karma; pali kamma (lit. action, deed of karmic significance)This is agency which brings forth 'existence' (yǒu 有 ) and is in turn caused by mental defilements (usually 'craving' (tṛṣṇā) and 'ignorance' (avidyā)); the concept of karma in India predates the emergence of Buddhism, but was somewhat redefined in Buddhism and Śākyamuni was said to have put much emphasis on the law of moral causality which is determined by one's actions; karma is often subdivided in three kind of actions: physical, shēnyè 身業, skr. kāya-karman, PALI kāya-kamma; verbal, kǒuyè 口業, SANSKRIT vāk-karman, PALI vacī-kamma; mental, yìyè 意業, skr. manas-karma, PALI mano-kamma, mental karma is sometims also referred to as 'non-manifest' or 'latent' action (skr. avijñapti, PALI aviññatti, wúbiǎoyè 無表業; another method of classifying karma is according to the nature of the actions, i.e. 'wholesome deeds', shànyè 善業, SANSKRIT kuśala-karman, PALI kusala-kamma; and 'evil deeds', èyè 惡業, skr. pāpa-karman, pali pāpa-kammaFocusing on the destiny after death which are caused by one's actions, karma is divided into fúyè 福業, 'meritorious actions' (skr. puṇya, pali puñña), and demeritorious actions, fēifúyè 非福業, skr. apuṇya, pali apuñña)(Actions which lead to rebirth in the three realms, sānjiè 三界 (including good and bad actions) are referred to as 'defiled actions' yǒulòuyè 有漏業, skr. sāsrava-karman; by contrast there are 'undefiled actions', wúlòuyè 無漏業, skr. anāsrava-karman (often referring to the actions of a Bodhisattva; in the case of Buddha one speaks of fóshì 佛事, 'Buddha-deeds', skr. buddha-kāryaThe concept of karma is further complicated by the question who and what transmigrates, since in Buddhism the existence of an entity surviving death is denied (one of the later approaches to solve thia aporia was the assumption of a 'storehouse-consciousness', ālaya-vijñāna by the Yogācāra School)

sense.def: BUDDH: dharma-hall (this refers to one of the main buildings of a Buddhist monastery, also called lecture-hall (jiǎngtáng 講堂). tls:text.tls:line: "There are appropriate ceremonies to be observed when a guest and host meet.

sense.def: ZUO: proper behaviour; BUDDH: the proper behaviour/right demeanor; in the Buddhist context referring to the proper conduct of monks and nuns as defined in the vinaya texts and other texts related to the precepts (the origin of this term is pre-Buddhist and refers to right behaviour, proper demeanor; in the Buddhist context referring to the proper conduct of monks and nuns which is defined especially in vinaya texts and texts related to the precepts. Often the term refers to four specific deportments in daily life (sìwēiyí 四威儀), i.e. when walking, standing, sitting, and lying down (representing the daily activities). See especially DDB (see also NAKAMURA: 33b; FOGUANG: 3771; according to Yanagida yǒubiǎo 有表 'have-expression > expressed, manifest' is a term typically used in the Vinaya School, referring to the concrete correct behaviour required in performing the 'three actions' (sānyè 三業, i.e. physical actions, oral expressions and thought processes). Often set in contrast to wúbiǎo jiè 無表戒 'un-expressed (non-manifest) precepts' (see YANAGIDA 1990: 396, fn. 269; on yǒubiǎo and wúbiǎo see also DDB) corr[CH])
